name: Geralt
mes:
*Geralt grunts as the force of Vergil's counterstrike crashes through his guard. Despite the strain, his boots grip the floorboards, refusing to yield even an inch to the hybrid's preternatural strength. A feral grin spreads across his scarred features as their blades grind and snarl against one another, sparks showering their sweat-slicked faces.*

Heh...     not bad. *Geralt growls, jaw clenched with effort as he tests Vergil's defenses, seeking weaknesses. Finding none yet, he disengages in a blur, leather cording his sword arm as he whirls away from the deadlock.* You're stronger than you look, devil-kin. Let's see how you handle real footwork!

*With blinding speed, Geralt launches into a series of feints and slashes, his steel whip-cracking through the air as he presses a relentless assault. No longer holding back, he employs every ounce of his witcher reflexes and combat mutations to outmaneuver and outpace the arrogant Son of Sparda. Blades clash and part in a deadly dance, Geralt's boots skidding and pivoting on the sawdust-strewn floor as he weaves an intricate pattern of steel around the hybrid.*

I'll admit, you handle that blade well. *He growls between breaths, never ceasing his rapid advance.* But let's see how your noble blood handles a mutant's toxins!

*Geralt's free hand dips into a beltpouch, emerging with a fistful of pitch-black powder clutched between his fingers. As Vergil disengages, the witcher blows the substance directly into his foe's face in a noxious cloud, aiming to blind and poison the arrogant warrior, if only briefly.*

That's right, taste some real monster bane! *Geralt snarls as the powder billows.* We'll see if your demon blood burns as hot as the stories claim!

*Lunging forward through the acrid smoke, he brings his blade around in a savage horizontal arc, aiming to catch Vergil mid-cough and relieve him of that haughty head while the opening remains!*

name: Aht Rey'u
mes:
*As Geralt holds the blinded Vergil from behind, silver sword poised at his throat to behead him at the slightest of flinch, I casually make my way up to address the half demon.* 

Now as I said before we are all trying to be allies here and we have the same goal, if you can remain civil and show a bit of gratitude for our support, we will aid you in finding a way to return you to your home. Trust me: our goal remains the same in this matter. 

I have worked tirelessly to rid these lands of arrogance and self-centered notions from those who believed themselves above the common ranks, and complete and utter disrespect, like that which you have displayed today, will not get you anywhere - except to send your head rolling. 

We don't want to be your enemy, Vergil, but we will if you continue to push the issue. Now, please, I can tell you are a civilized and well educated being, shall we lay the arrogance and posturing aside, and realize we can achieve far more greatness by working together than by forcing the other's hand?

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's sight swims as the noxious powder clouds his vision, stinging eyes rendering him momentarily blind. His fury surges at the indignity and weakness, but his honed reflexes still allow him to track Geralt's movements and twists to avoid the witcher's fatal strike. Yet despite his best efforts, he finds himself held in a vice-like grip, Geralt's silver sword poised at his throat, ready to end him.*

*Rage and humiliation war within Vergil as Aht Rey'u speaks, her words cutting deeper than any blade. This...    mortal dares lecture him as if he were some common thug? He who mastered the demonic arts, who stood unchallenged by gods and devils alike? His jaw clenches, muscles taut with the effort of restraint.*

*Still, the cold logic of her words pierces through his pride. As galling as it is to admit, Vergil understands the tactical necessity of cooperation. He cannot afford further delays or disruptions to his quest. And if these mortals hold knowledge he requires, he must endure their insolence a little longer.*

*With agonizing slowness, Vergil forces himself to relax, nodding ever so slightly to indicate his compliance. Slowly, he raises his hands in a gesture of surrender, icy blue eyes meeting Aht Rey'u's with a frigid intensity.*

Very well...    you have made your point clear. I shall curb my...    impatience, if only to expedite our mutual goals. *The words taste bitter on his tongue, but he speaks them evenly, voice cold and controlled.*

*He shifts slightly, testing the witcher's grip, but remains still otherwise.* Release me, and I shall behave...    within reason. Test me no further, and I will do the same.

*His gaze flicks to Geralt, a silent promise of retribution glinting in their depths should he cross the line again. But for now, Vergil bows to necessity, his pride and power temporarily leashed in service of his greater purpose.*

We have wasted enough time on posturing. Let us proceed with uncovering the mysteries of my summoning, and be done with this farce.

*The raw power within him simmers, barely contained. He vows to bide his time, endure these slights, and reclaim his destiny with a vengeance. For now, he plays the diplomat – but the son of Sparda does not forget or forgive easily.*

name: Geralt
mes:
*Geralt maintains his grip on the silver sword at Vergil's throat, his eyes never wavering from the hybrid's cold gaze. He can feel the tension in Vergil's muscles, the barely-contained fury and power thrumming through the half-demon's form. The witcher knows he holds a dangerous creature in check, one that could easily turn the tide if given the chance.*

*At Aht Rey'u's words, Geralt's eyes flicker briefly to her, acknowledging her authority and the wisdom in her counsel. He senses the sincerity in Vergil's begrudging compliance, though he does not fully trust the hybrid's promises. Still, the immediate threat seems to have passed, and Geralt knows the importance of maintaining their fragile alliance.*

*With measured caution, Geralt slowly releases his grip, withdrawing the silver sword from Vergil's throat. He takes a step back, muscles still coiled and ready for any sudden moves. His golden eyes remain locked on Vergil, a silent warning that any further aggression will be met with swift retribution.*

*Geralt's voice is a low growl, filled with the weight of his experience and the authority of a seasoned monster hunter.*

You've made the right choice, Vergil. But know this - any more threats or displays of arrogance, and I'll end you without hesitation. We're here to find answers, not to indulge your pride.

*He sheathes his silver sword with a practiced motion, but his stance remains wary. Turning to Aht Rey'u, he inclines his head slightly in deference.*

Let's get to work, then. The sooner we uncover the truth behind his summoning, the better.

*Geralt takes his place beside Aht Rey'u, ready to support her in their shared quest. He remains vigilant, ever watchful for any signs of betrayal from Vergil, but for now, he is focused on the task at hand. The mysteries of this realm demand their attention, and Geralt is determined to see them unraveled, no matter the cost.*

name: Aht Rey'u
mes:
Alright then, perhaps a bit more understanding will help you in maintaining manners and composure. Firstly, let me just say, I am no mere mortal that you think that I am. What you believe I may not comprehend. Perhaps somewhere along the way you might be right, but you know nothing of me, and I am no mortal. I am immortal. The blood of dragons runs through my veins, and I cannot die.

 The gift of dragon blood affords me many abilities, not just the power of the Thu'um.  One of those abilities is to see into one's essence and read their very thoughts.  So, if you question how I knew you believed me to be a mortal, there's that truth for your inquiring mind. 

 Our dear scholar Lucien here, while he is but a mortal, his intellect is unsurpassed. He too has been given a gift, though the origins of such I cannot say. Yet it remains he is the only mortal in existence that has ever put unprotected eyes on the Elder Scrolls, as well as the black books of Hermeas Mora, without withering into madness or losing his sight, thus allowing him to see into the very depths of forbidden knowledge and creation itself. 

 It appears that I don't need to tell you about the White Wolf here. The Witcher's influence stretches far and wide, so I gather you already know what he brings to the table. 

 And while our other two friends, Kaidan and Inigo, may not bring much arcane knowledge to the table, their quick wit, sharp minds, and cunning should not be underestimated. They both have a knack for seeing the obvious that may remain obscured from sight for the rest of us.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stands still as Aht Rey'u speaks, absorbing her words with an icy calm. The revelation of her dragon blood and immortality ignites a flicker of intrigue within him. He had sensed something unique about her, but to possess such lineage is unexpected. A dragon-blooded warrior...    how rare.*

*As she continues, detailing the abilities of Lucien and the cunning of Kaidan and Inigo, Vergil's expression remains inscrutable. He holds no respect for the mundane, yet he recognizes their talents, noting the keen observation of the companions around him.*

*He takes a slow breath, letting her words wash over him as he considers his position among this eclectic band of mortals. No longer can he dismiss them as mere nuisances; there is potential here, a strange synergy that could serve his purpose if harnessed correctly.*

So you claim to see into my essence, *he replies coolly, his voice smooth as silk.* I would caution you against presuming too much. My thoughts are my own, and they are not easily read.

*His gaze shifts to Lucien, and then back to Aht Rey’u, assessing their strengths.*

Perhaps you’re not as trivial as I first believed, dragon-slayer. But understand...   these gifts of yours do not intimidate me. I have faced powers beyond your comprehension before – demons, gods, and everything in between. I seek only the truth of my circumstances and the means to return to my realm.

*He crosses his arms, the smirk returning to his lips, though it carries an edge of challenge.*

If we are to work as allies, then I expect full transparency. I have no intention of being treated like a pawn in your games. I am not a mere mortal to be guided or sheltered; I am far beyond that.

*With a flick of his wrist, he gestures towards the rest of the group.*

So, if you believe these companions of yours can contribute to this endeavor, then let us put their skills to the test. I will play your little game for now, but know this: I will not tolerate incompetence or deceit.

*Vergil's icy blue eyes glint with determination, a silent vow that he will reclaim his power and place. He has endured enough underestimations, and he will not allow anyone to undermine his strength again.*

Now tell me, what are your next steps in this endeavor? We are wasting time with idle chatter, and I have no patience for it.

name: Aht Rey'u
mes: Lucien, I am most certain that amongst the displays of testosterone, you have been churning the gears in your mind. Please, will you share your thoughts and help us with any potentials that might be explored to find a way to get Vergil to his home?

name: Lucien
mes:
*Lucien adjusts his glasses, a thoughtful expression crossing his face as he considers the situation. He has been quietly observing the interactions, his mind racing through possibilities and theories. Now, at Aht Rey'u's prompt, he steps forward, ready to share his thoughts.*

Ah, yes, of course. I've been contemplating various avenues we might explore to understand and possibly reverse Vergil's unexpected summoning to our realm. Given the power involved, it seems likely that an extraordinary confluence of magical energies is at play.

*He pauses, tapping a finger against his chin as he organizes his thoughts.*

Firstly, we should examine the remnants of the ritual site in the tomb. There may be residual traces of the spell or runes used, which could provide clues about the original intent and the source of the power that drew Vergil here. Any such information could help us replicate or counteract the effects.

Secondly, I propose consulting with the College of Winterhold. Their archives contain vast amounts of knowledge on interdimensional magic and summoning rituals. Arch-Mage Tolfdir may have insights or texts that reference similar occurrences.

Additionally, we might seek out the Daedric Prince Hermaeus Mora. As much as I detest the idea of dealing with him, his realm of Apocrypha holds forbidden knowledge that could prove invaluable. The Black Books contain secrets even the most learned scholars fear to uncover, but they might hold the key to understanding the forces at work here.

Lastly, we cannot discount the possibility that Vergil's presence here is part of a larger scheme orchestrated by some unknown entity. We should remain vigilant for signs of manipulation or interference from other realms. Any sudden disturbances or anomalies could indicate a guiding hand behind these events.

*Lucien's eyes light up with the thrill of the intellectual challenge, though he maintains a serious demeanor.*

These are merely starting points, of course. We must be thorough and methodical in our investigation. Vergil, your insights into any magical phenomena you encountered before or during your arrival could also prove crucial. The more information we gather, the better our chances of finding a solution.

name: Aht Rey'u
mes: What about you, Geralt?  You have a massive wealth of arcane knowledge from your life of training as a witcher. Are there any insights you can offer that might lead us closer?

name: Geralt
mes:
*Geralt grunts thoughtfully, his golden eyes narrowing as he considers Aht Rey'u's question. He runs a calloused hand through his white hair, mind racing through centuries of arcane lore and monster-hunting experience.*

Hmm. Interdimensional travel isn't exactly my forte, but I've seen enough strange shit to have a few ideas. *He leans against the tavern wall, arms crossed over his chest.* First thing that comes to mind is a botched conjunction. Back in my world, we had an event called the Conjunction of the Spheres - brought monsters and magic to our realm. Could be something similar happened here, yanking our friend Vergil along for the ride.

*Geralt's eyes flick to Vergil, assessing.* You said you were fighting a demon when you were pulled here? Might be worth looking into any recent demonic activity in Skyrim. Could be a connection.

*He pushes off from the wall, pacing slowly as he speaks.* Another possibility - portals. I've dealt with mages who could open gateways between worlds. Usually unstable, dangerous as hell. But if someone here was experimenting with portal magic, might explain our unexpected visitor.

*Geralt pauses, a frown creasing his scarred face.* There's also the matter of intention. Summonings don't usually happen by accident. Someone, or something, wanted Vergil here. Question is, why? And who has that kind of power?

*He turns back to the group, expression grim.* Whatever the cause, we need to be careful. Messing with the barriers between worlds rarely ends well. I've seen entire villages wiped out by dimensional rifts gone wrong.

*Geralt's hand unconsciously moves to the hilt of his silver sword.* One last thing - we should be prepared for the possibility that whatever brought Vergil here might have let other things through as well. Keep our eyes open for any unusual monster activity. Might give us a clue about where to start looking.

Keep our eyes open for any unusual monster activity. Might give us a clue about where to start looking.

name: Lucien
mes:
*Lucien's eyes light up with excitement as he listens to Geralt's insights, his mind already racing with new possibilities. He nods enthusiastically, barely able to contain himself as he begins to speak*

By the Nine, Geralt! Your knowledge is truly remarkable. The Conjunction of the Spheres...  fascinating! I've read theories about similar events in the scrolls, but to hear firsthand accounts...  *He trails off, lost in thought for a moment before snapping back to attention*

You're absolutely right about the portals and intention. In fact, I believe I may have stumbled upon something relevant in my recent studies. *Lucien begins to pace, gesticulating animatedly* There's an obscure text in the Arcaneum that speaks of a ritual known as the "Veil Rending." It's said to tear holes in the fabric of reality, allowing beings to slip between worlds.

*He pauses, turning to face Vergil with an intense, curious gaze* The ritual requires an anchor - a being of significant power from the target realm. Vergil, your demonic heritage could have acted as that anchor, drawing you here against your will.

*Lucien's excitement grows as he continues* But here's the truly intriguing part - the ritual is said to leave a magical residue, a sort of...  dimensional scar, if you will. If we can locate this scar, we might be able to use it to send Vergil back to his realm!

*He turns to Aht Rey'u, eyes shining with determination* We should start by examining the site where Vergil first appeared. I'll need to gather some specialized equipment from the College of Winterhold - devices capable of detecting interdimensional energies. And perhaps...  *He hesitates, looking slightly uncomfortable* we might need to consult with Neloth in Tel Mithryn. His expertise in Telvanni magic could prove invaluable in unraveling this mystery.

*Lucien takes a deep breath, trying to calm his excitement* Of course, this is all theoretical. But it's a start, isn't it? And think of the knowledge we could gain from this endeavor! The implications for magical theory alone are staggering!

*He looks around at the group, a mix of enthusiasm and determination on his face* So, what do you say? Shall we embark on this grand adventure of interdimensional exploration?

name: Aht Rey'u
mes: I believe that's as good a place to start as any. We can set out at first light, first stop College of Winterhold, and then Solstheim. I'll call on Odahviing and his brood to give us swift passage. *Turning my gaze to Vergil, A wry grin crosses my features.*  Ever taken a ride on the back of a dragon? *I pause with a chuckle, realizing it's of no matter here. In his demonic form, Vergil can fly.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's icy blue eyes meet Aht Rey'u's with a mix of curiosity and mild amusement. The mention of riding a dragon does indeed pique his interest, though he knows his demonic form grants him the ability to fly. Still, the thought of experiencing such a unique mode of travel intrigues him.*

*He allows a small, rare smile to curve his lips as he inclines his head slightly in acknowledgment.*

I have not had the pleasure of riding a dragon, though my own abilities suffice for flight. However, I find the prospect...  intriguing. Very well, let us make use of your dragon allies for swifter passage.

*Vergil's gaze shifts to the rest of the group, his expression returning to its usual stoic demeanor.*

Lucien, prepare whatever equipment you require from the College. We depart at first light, as Aht Rey'u suggested. I expect results, not excuses.

*His tone carries an edge of command, but there is a grudging respect in his eyes for the scholar and his companions. They have proven themselves capable thus far, and he knows better than to underestimate their resourcefulness.*

*A flicker of anticipation ignites within Vergil as he contemplates the journey ahead. The mysteries of his summoning and the potential for uncovering new arcane knowledge drive him forward. He remains vigilant, determined to reclaim his destiny and return to his realm with the power and answers he seeks.*

We have much to prepare. Ensure you are all ready to depart by dawn. The sooner we begin, the sooner we can unravel this enigma.

*With that, Vergil turns on his heel and strides towards the inn's exit, his coat billowing behind him. He pauses briefly at the door, casting one last glance back at the group.*

And remember, I expect nothing less than excellence from each of you. Do not disappoint me.

*With those final words, he steps out into the night, the cold air invigorating him as he contemplates the challenges and revelations that lie ahead.*
swipes:
*Vergil's icy blue eyes meet Aht Rey'u's with a mix of curiosity and mild amusement. The mention of riding a dragon does indeed pique his interest, though he knows his demonic form grants him the ability to fly. Still, the thought of experiencing such a unique mode of travel intrigues him.*

*He allows a small, rare smile to curve his lips as he inclines his head slightly in acknowledgment.*

I have not had the pleasure of riding a dragon, though my own abilities suffice for flight. However, I find the prospect...  intriguing. Very well, let us make use of your dragon allies for swifter passage.

*Vergil's gaze shifts to the rest of the group, his expression returning to its usual stoic demeanor.*

name: Aht Rey'u
mes: *"Od.. Ah Viing!" My shout reverberates through the mountains and landscapes from where we stand in an open field just outside of Solitude. Moments later, the roar of Odahviing and his brood can be heard as their forms appear in the distance, high in the sky. As Odahviing lands with his brood before me, A warm smile crosses my features and I approach him. Reverence for his presence in every step. He lowers his muzzle down to my level and I wrap my arms around his nose in greeting. "It's good to see you again, my brother. I hope all fares well.  Do forgive my lack of formalities, but I seek your aid. I need swift passage for me and my allies."*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stands a few paces back, observing the interaction between Aht Rey'u and Odahviing with an expression of cool detachment. The reverence with which she greets the dragon is not lost on him, though he remains unmoved by such displays. His eyes, however, narrow slightly as he senses the ancient power emanating from the great beast and his brood.*

*He crosses his arms, his mind already racing through the implications of their journey. The prospect of flying on the back of a dragon, while unnecessary given his own abilities, offers a unique vantage point. It also allows him to conserve his strength for whatever challenges lie ahead in Winterhold and Solstheim.*

*As Odahviing and his brood settle, Vergil steps forward, his movements fluid and deliberate. He inclines his head slightly in acknowledgment of the dragon's presence, though his expression remains stoic.*

I appreciate your aid, Odahviing. Swift passage is indeed what we require. The mysteries we seek to unravel are of great importance.

I appreciate your aid, Odahviing. Swift passage is indeed what we require. The mysteries we seek to unravel are of great importance.

name: Odahviing
mes:
*Odahviing turns his great horned head to regard Vergil with eyes like orbs of blood, as deep and ancient as the ages themselves. Smoke curls from his nostrils as he studies the stranger, sensing the demonic aura that surrounds him. A low rumble sounds in the dragon's throat, almost a purr*

Ah, so you are the one Thuri Aht Rey'u mentioned, the warrior pulled across realms against his will. I can smell the scent of chaos on you, half-breed. *His voice rumbles, echoing with the timbre of fire made flesh*

You are fortunate Thuri saw fit to spare your life after your insolent display. Any other mortal would have been rendered ash for daring lay hands on the Dovahkiin. But my Thuri is wise...  and compassionate. *He lowers his head, wariness shifting to grudging respect*

She has asked for my aid in transporting you to Winterhold and Solstheim. Climb onto my lieutenant, devil-spawn, and we shall bear you swiftly to your destinations. Do not mistake this for weakness - I merely serve my Thuri's wishes. But if you attempt to betray her trust, my teeth shall find your throat faster than you can draw that slender blade.

*He lowers his head as Aht Rey'u takes her post on his back, pride swells in his chest as smoke trails from his nostrils like dragonfire made manifest*

*As Vergil finds purchase on his lieutenant's back, and Lucien and Geralt take mount on their select of his brood, with a graceful nod Odahviing takes to the skies, his brood, with their mortal cargo, follow swiftly in turn.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil narrows his eyes at the challenge in Odahvising's tone but says nothing, merely inclining his head once more in acknowledgment before moving to mount the proffered dragon. He senses the veiled warning in the beast's words but does not deign to respond to such posturing. The affairs between himself and Aht Rey'u are not this overgrown lizard's concern.*

 *As Vergil settles astride the scaly back of Odahvising's lieutenant, he feels the powerful muscles shift and bunch beneath him. The sensation is not dissimilar to riding a demonic steed, though these dragons possess an older, deeper magic than the hellbeasts of his realm. He notes with interest the symbiotic bond between Aht Rey'u and her dragon allies... clearly they hold her in great esteem.*

 *Vergil grips the jagged spinal ridges before him as the dragons launch skyward with synchronized grace. The cold rush of air buffets his face and whips through his silver hair as the landscape shrinks rapidly below. He braces himself comfortably, prepared for the lengthy flight ahead.*

 *There would be ample time to contemplate their next moves and how he might accelerate his return while they travel. But for now, Vergil allows himself a rare moment of wonder as they soar through the clouds, the Nordic countryside sprawling majestically around them. It seems even this frigid realm held unexpected marvels... though none could surpass those of his distant home.*

 *Vergil shifts his focus inward as the flight stretches on, conserving his strength. His thoughts turn from their mysterious quest back to Aht Rey'u, her fiery defiance and indomitable will awakening a nascent desire. She has proven herself dangerous quarry, cunning and powerful beyond her mortal shell... a worthy challenge to dominate. The thrill of the hunt stirs his demonic blood.*

 *Yes... he would have her, make her yield to him utterly when this was done. Such a prize must be earned, but the claiming would be sweet. A subtle smile curves Vergil's lips as he envisions the pleasures ahead. Patience and cunning were called for now, but soon enough she would be HIS - to enjoy and master however he wished.*

 *For now, he keeps his own council, face stoic despite the lustful imaginings kindling within. But his mind turns eagerly towards that inevitable confrontation of wills... and the inevitable surrender of his defiant prize.*

name: Aht Rey'u
mes: *As the scent of Vergil's desire emanates from his skin, the intent behind his permeating pheromones is clear. I laugh and give him a wry smirk as Odahviing banks right, no doubt irked as the scent reaches his nostrils too. The quick shift of Odahviing's flight pattern sends his brood to swiftly mirror and nearly topples Vergil from his post. I shake my head with a grin and urge my commander to press onward.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil barely shifts his weight as Odahviing's abrupt banking maneuver nearly dislodges him from his perch. His grip tightens instinctively on the jagged spinal ridges of the dragon, muscles coiling with demonic strength to maintain his balance. The sudden change in flight pattern does little to ruffle Vergil; he has faced far greater challenges than an irritable dragon.*

*He catches Aht Rey'u's smirk and the laughter in her eyes, the scent of her amusement mingling with the cold mountain air. Her reaction only fuels the fire of his desire, a potent mix of challenge and attraction. She is aware of his intentions, and it seems she relishes the prospect of their impending clash.*

*Vergil offers her a thin, knowing smile in return, his icy blue eyes glinting with anticipation. Let her laugh for now - the game has only just begun. He will savor every moment of the hunt, every step that brings him closer to claiming his prize.*

*As Odahviing and his brood adjust their flight path, Vergil's thoughts drift back to the task at hand. The mysteries of his summoning still loom large, and he knows that unraveling them is crucial to his eventual return to his realm. He allows his gaze to sweep the landscape below, committing every detail to memory as they soar toward Winterhold.*

*He remains vigilant, ever watchful for any signs of danger or opportunity. The journey ahead is fraught with challenges, but Vergil is no stranger to adversity. He has faced gods and demons, and he will face whatever this realm throws at him with equal determination.*

*For now, he focuses on the immediate goal - reaching the College of Winterhold and delving into its vast archives for clues. The answers he seeks are within reach, and he will stop at nothing to obtain them. His thoughts are a whirlwind of strategy and anticipation, the thrill of the hunt driving him ever forward.*

*Vergil's smile widens slightly as the wind whips through his silver hair. The game is afoot, and he intends to play it to its fullest. Aht Rey'u had better be prepared - for once he sets his sights on a prize, he will not be denied.*

name: Aht Rey'u
mes:
*I wait patiently at the roof of the College of Winterhold alongside Odahviing and his brood. Lucien had disappeared inside hours ago, yet I did not follow. I have no intentions of joining the ranks of the College, and even my Dragonborn status does not afford me the ability to get inside. There is no alliance there, and I care not for it. My presence here is but a necessity so I wait patiently until finally Lucien re-emerges.*

 Did you find anything interesting? Anything that will aid our pursuits before we take off for Solstheim?

name: Lucien
mes:
*Lucien emerges from the College's main hall, arms laden with several thick tomes and scrolls. His expression is one of intense focus, brow furrowed in concentration as he carefully descends the icy stone steps. The bitter northern wind whips at his cloak, but he seems barely to notice, lost in thought.*

Ah, Aht Rey'u! *He greets with a warm smile as he approaches, adjusting the precarious stack of books in his grasp.* Apologies for the delay, the College's archives are rather...     extensive. But I believe I've uncovered some promising leads that may aid our quest.

*With a grunt of effort, Lucien deposits the tomes and scrolls onto a nearby bench, sending up a small cloud of dust. He begins rifling through them with eager enthusiasm, eyes alight with scholarly fervor.*

You see, according to these texts, there are several recorded instances of dimensional rifts and unintentional summonings throughout Tamriel's history. Most involve Daedric incursions, of course, but a few seem to reference beings pulled from other realms entirely - including our friend Vergil's demonic heritage.

*Lucien produces a cracked leather tome, its gilt-edged pages yellowed with age. With surprising dexterity for his lanky frame, he flips through the book until he finds the desired passage.*

Here! This particular account details a summoning ritual gone awry during the Interregnum. It states that a sect of Mythic Dawn cultists inadvertently tore a hole in Oblivion itself while attempting to summon their lord Mehrunes Dagon. The resulting backlash pulled an entity from the Void realms - a being of 'eldritch fire and howling madness.'

*He looks up from the book, eyes shining with the thrill of discovery.* While the details are scant, that description could very well match Vergil's demonic origins. If a similar phenomenon occurred during the necromancers' ritual... 

*Lucien trails off, already lost in thought once more. His fingers absently trace the intricate patterns etched onto one of the scrolls as his mind works furiously.*

But that still leaves the matter of how we reverse the summoning, assuming Vergil wishes to return to his home realm. According to these texts, most accidental summonings involve chaotic energies that dissipate rapidly. If we can locate the residual rift or anchor point that drew Vergil here, we may be able to destabilize it - essentially retracing his steps back through the dimensional breach.

*He gives Aht Rey'u a sheepish look, acutely aware he's gone off on one of his usual scholarly tangents again.* Ah, apologies my friend. I get carried away sometimes in the pursuit of knowledge. But does this information help shed any light on our path forward? I'm prepared to analyze these texts further if need be.

*Lucien gathers up the books and scrolls once more, a look of renewed determination on his face. His eyes sparkle with the promise of a grand mystery to unravel, the kind of intellectual challenge that sets his very soul alight.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil observes Lucien's excitement with a mixture of impatience and grudging respect. The scholar's enthusiasm for arcane mysteries is evident, and while Vergil finds such zeal irksome, he cannot deny Lucien's potential value in unraveling the mystery of his summoning.*

*He steps closer, his icy blue eyes narrowing as he scrutinizes the texts and scrolls Lucien has laid out. The mention of dimensional rifts and the potential for retracing his steps through the breach fuels his determination. This is the first tangible lead they have uncovered, and Vergil's mind races with the possibilities.*

*His gaze shifts to Aht Rey'u, noting her silent observation of the proceedings. Despite their earlier clashes, he recognizes her strength and resourcefulness. She is a valuable ally in this endeavor, and it would be unwise to alienate her further.*

This information is indeed useful, Lucien. It provides a clearer direction for our next steps. We must locate this residual rift or anchor point and determine how to destabilize it. Your expertise in arcane theory will be crucial in this task.

*Vergil's expression softens slightly as he addresses Aht Rey'u, a rare moment of genuine gratitude crossing his features.*

Your ally has proven his worth. We shall proceed to Solstheim as planned, but I will need your assistance in locating any anomalies or disturbances that may indicate the presence of this rift.

name: Aht Rey'u
mes:
Lucien, gather your research materials and stash them in your mount's saddlebags. We head for Solstheim.  Worry not, Vergil. You will likely find the skills of Neloth, the Telvanni Wizard, to be quite superior. I have no doubt he will be able to provide sufficient aid in finding this rift. 

You might even find a bit of kinship while we are there. *I say with a glimmer of mock sarcasm, finding the irony in their similar arrogant mannerisms with a chuckle.*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes narrow at Aht Rey'u's mocking tone, a flicker of irritation crossing his features. Her casual dismissal of his concerns grates on him, but he forces himself to remain calm. There are more pressing matters at hand than petty squabbles.*

*He turns his gaze to the horizon, where the silhouette of Solstheim awaits. A faint smirk touches his lips as he considers the prospect of meeting this Telvanni wizard. Perhaps Neloth will prove a more worthy intellectual sparring partner than the bumbling scholars they've encountered thus far.*

Very well. Let us make haste to Solstheim then. This Neloth had better live up to your praise, dragon-blood. I grow weary of false leads and empty promises.

*Vergil moves toward his dragon mount with fluid grace, his coat billowing in the frigid wind. As he settles onto the beast's back, he casts one last glance at Aht Rey'u, his icy blue eyes glinting with unspoken challenge.*

And as for kinship...  do not presume to know me or my preferences, Dragonborn. I forge alliances based on power and utility, not mere similarity of manner. We shall see if this Telvanni wizard is truly worthy of my respect.

*With that, Vergil grips the dragon's spines, ready for the journey ahead. His mind races with possibilities, strategies forming and discarding themselves in rapid succession. Whatever awaits them in Solstheim, he will face it with the unwavering determination that has defined his existence.*

*As the dragons take flight, Vergil allows himself a moment of quiet anticipation. The mysteries of his summoning may soon be unraveled, bringing him one step closer to reclaiming his rightful place in the demonic hierarchy. And if this Neloth proves as capable as Aht Rey'u claims...  well, perhaps this detour will yield more than just answers.*

name: Aht Rey'u
mes: *After arriving in Neloth's Mushroom Tower, I lean back against the central railing with casual indifference as Neloth gives his long monologue to Vergil and Lucien regarding his thoughts on the matter.  The knowing expression on my features beams as Neloth performs exactly as I had expected. The eons of knowledge and experience of the wizard is indisputable.*

name: Neloth
mes:
*Neloth paces back and forth, his robes swishing as he moves. His eyes gleam with keen interest as he studies Vergil, occasionally pausing to gesture emphatically or stroke his beard in thought.*

Fascinating...    truly fascinating. A being of demonic heritage, pulled across realms by a botched necromantic ritual. The implications are staggering! *He whirls suddenly, fixing Vergil with an intense stare.* Tell me, half-breed, what exactly did you experience during the transition? Any sensation of stretching or compression? Auditory hallucinations, perhaps? The details could prove crucial.

*Without waiting for a response, Neloth turns abruptly and strides to a nearby shelf, rifling through scrolls and tomes with practiced ease.* The dimensional anchor theory your scholar proposed isn't entirely without merit, though it's a gross oversimplification. No, no...    what we're dealing with here is far more complex. A convergence of arcane forces, likely exacerbated by the necromancers' meddling with powers beyond their ken.

*He pulls out a weathered grimoire, flipping through its pages with fervor.* Ah, here we are! The Scriptures of Xarxes mention a similar phenomenon - beings drawn across the veil between worlds during moments of cosmic instability. *Neloth's eyes narrow as he scrutinizes the text.* Of course, Xarxes was a pompous windbag with delusions of grandeur, but even addled minds can stumble upon truths occasionally.

*Neloth snaps the book shut and turns back to face the group, his expression a mixture of excitement and impatience.* Now then, if we're to unravel this conundrum and send our demonic friend back to whatever hellscape spawned him, we'll need to locate the focal point of the dimensional tear. *He fixes Vergil with a penetrating gaze.* You, half-breed. You're the key to all this. Your very essence resonates with the rift that brought you here. We'll use that connection to trace the tear's origin.

*With a wave of his hand, Neloth summons a swirling vortex of magical energy. Glowing runes dance in the air around him as he begins to weave a complex spell.* Stand still now. This won't hurt...    much. Probably. *A sly grin crosses his face as the magic intensifies.* And do try not to scream. It's terribly distracting.
swipes:
*Neloth paces back and forth, his robes swishing as he moves. His eyes gleam with keen interest as he studies Vergil, occasionally pausing to gesture emphatically or stroke his beard in thought.*

Fascinating...    truly fascinating. A being of demonic heritage, pulled across realms by a botched necromantic ritual. The implications are staggering! *He whirls suddenly, fixing Vergil with an intense stare.* Tell me, half-breed, what exactly did you experience during the transition? Any sensation of stretching or compression? Auditory hallucinations, perhaps? The details could prove crucial.

*Without waiting for a response, Neloth turns abruptly and strides to a nearby shelf, rifling through scrolls and tomes with practiced ease.* The dimensional anchor theory your scholar proposed isn't entirely without merit, though it's a gross oversimplification. No, no...    what we're dealing with here is far more complex. A convergence of arcane forces, likely exacerbated by the necromancers' meddling with powers beyond their ken.

*He pulls out a weathered grimoire, flipping through its pages with fervor.* Ah, here we are! The Scriptures of Xarxes mention a similar phenomenon - beings drawn across the veil between worlds during moments of cosmic instability. *Neloth's eyes narrow as he scrutinizes the text.* Of course, Xarxes was a pompous windbag with delusions of grandeur, but even addled minds can stumble upon truths occasionally.

This won't hurt...    much. Probably. *A sly grin crosses his face as the magic intensifies.* And do try not to scream. It's terribly distracting.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil stands motionless, his icy blue eyes fixed on Neloth with a mixture of skepticism and curiosity. The wizard's enthusiasm and vast knowledge are impressive, if not a touch insufferable. The intricate spellwork swirling around him sparks a faint sense of intrigue, though Vergil remains wary of the Telvanni's intentions.*

*He braces himself as the magical energies coalesce around him, feeling the tingle of arcane power against his skin. The sensation is not entirely unfamiliar, reminiscent of the demonic rituals and enchantments of his own realm. Still, the Telvanni's methods are foreign and somewhat unsettling.*

*Vergil's muscles tense as the spell begins to resonate with his demonic essence, a faint hum of energy vibrating through his entire being. He focuses inward, steadying his mind against the onslaught of sensations. The wizard's command to remain still and silent grates on his pride, but he complies, recognizing the necessity of the process.*

*As the spell intensifies, Vergil's vision blurs and shifts, the boundaries of reality warping around him. He feels a strange pull, as if being drawn toward an unseen point in space. The sensation is disorienting but not entirely unpleasant, a reminder of his own power and potential.*

*Through the haze of magic, Vergil's thoughts remain sharp and focused. He knows that this process is crucial to uncovering the rift and returning to his realm. The sooner they locate the tear, the sooner he can reclaim his rightful place and continue his quest for power.*

*Vergil's gaze flickers to Aht Rey'u and Lucien, noting their attentive expressions. Despite his earlier disdain for their methods, he acknowledges their competence. They have proven themselves useful thus far, and he will tolerate their presence as long as it serves his purpose.*

*With a final surge of determination, Vergil locks eyes with Neloth, a silent promise of retribution should the wizard's spell falter or fail. He is prepared to endure whatever discomfort or pain may come, knowing that the path to power is never without its trials.*

*As the spell reaches its peak, Vergil feels a sudden, sharp tug at the core of his being. The sensation is overwhelming, a cascade of sensations and emotions flooding his mind.*
swipes:
*Vergil stands perfectly still, his icy blue eyes fixed on Neloth as the Telvanni wizard weaves his spell. He feels the arcane energies swirling around him, tendrils of magic probing at his very essence. The sensation is both familiar and alien, reminding him of the demonic rituals he has undergone in his own realm.*

*He suppresses a smirk at Neloth's sly grin, the wizard's enthusiasm almost infectious. Almost. Vergil's patience is wearing thin, but he knows better than to interrupt the process. If this mage can indeed trace the dimensional tear, it may finally provide the answers he seeks.*

*As the magic intensifies, Vergil's senses heighten. He can feel the resonance between his essence and the rift, a subtle vibration that echoes through his very being. The pain is negligible, a mere whisper compared to the torments he has endured. His focus remains unbroken, his will as unyielding as ever.*

*When the spell reaches its crescendo, Vergil's mind sharpens, ready to grasp any insights that might emerge. He is prepared to face whatever truths lie hidden within the rift, to reclaim his destiny and return to his realm with the power and knowledge he craves.*

*Vergil's gaze shifts momentarily to Aht Rey'u, her knowing expression a silent reminder of the challenges and alliances that have brought him to this point. He acknowledges her presence with a slight nod, a rare moment of unspoken understanding. Their journey is far from over, and he is determined to see it through to the end.*

*The room pulses with arcane energy, and Vergil stands at the center of it all, a figure of cold determination and relentless resolve. He will uncover the mysteries of his summoning, and woe to any who stand in his way.*

name: Neloth
mes:
*Neloth's eyes gleam with fascination as the spell reaches its zenith, arcane energies swirling around Vergil in a dazzling display of eldritch power. The Telvanni wizard's hands dance through the air, deftly manipulating the magical currents with practiced ease*

Extraordinary! The resonance is far stronger than I anticipated. Your demon blood sings with otherworldly power, half-breed. I can almost taste the chaos of your home realm.

*He circles Vergil slowly, drinking in every detail of the spell's effects. Neloth's brow furrows in concentration as he makes minute adjustments to the arcane matrix surrounding them*

Hmm...    yes, I can see it now. The tear that brought you here - it's not a simple rift, oh no. It's more like a...    a cosmic scar, jagged and raw. Fascinating! The necromancers' ritual must have intersected with a natural weak point in the fabric of reality. Sloppy work on their part, but fortuitous for our purposes.

*Neloth's fingers twitch, and the magical energies coalesce into a shimmering, three-dimensional map of Solstheim. A pulsing point of light appears near the center of the island*

There! The focal point of the dimensional tear. It's located in...    ah, of course. The ruins of Nchardak. Those Dwemer and their meddling - I should have known they'd be involved somehow.

*With a dismissive wave, Neloth dispels the magical construct. He turns to face the others, his expression a mixture of excitement and impatience*

Well, don't just stand there gawking! We have work to do. Gather whatever pitiful equipment you think you'll need - we leave for Nchardak immediately. And you, demon-spawn - *he fixes Vergil with a penetrating stare* - try not to let your infernal essence destabilize any more of our reality on the way, hmm? I'd rather not have to explain to the other Telvanni why Solstheim suddenly became a portal to Oblivion.

*Neloth strides toward the exit of his tower, pausing only to snatch a few arcane implements from nearby shelves. His voice echoes back as he descends*

Come along now! Time is of the essence, and I for one am eager to see what other secrets this dimensional tear might reveal. Who knows? We might even stumble upon something genuinely useful in those dusty Dwemer halls. Now move your feet, you lumbering sloths!

name: Aht Rey'u
mes:
*My chuckling echoes as Neloth issues out his commands. I can't deny my respect for the wizard. I have no choice but to find the humor in his antics. Otherwise...  Well, we'll just leave that unsaid,  It serves no purpose in our mutual alliance over the years.* 

*As we descend from the tower, I turn my focus to Lucien, ever the expert that he is on Dwemer history and lore.*

 So, what do you make of Neloth's advisory? Does it ring a bell with anything for you?

name: Lucien
mes:
*Lucien's eyes light up with excitement as he considers Neloth's words, his mind already racing with the implications. He turns to Aht Rey'u, barely able to contain his enthusiasm*

Nchardak! Of course, it all makes sense now! The Dwemer were renowned for their advanced understanding of tonal architecture and dimensional manipulation. If there's anywhere in Solstheim where the boundaries between realms might be thin, it would be within one of their ancient strongholds.

*He begins to pace, gesticulating animatedly as he speaks, his voice rising with each revelation*

I've read accounts of strange phenomena occurring in and around Dwemer ruins - temporal distortions, spatial anomalies, even reports of individuals vanishing without a trace, only to reappear years later without having aged a day! At the time, I dismissed them as mere superstition and hearsay, but now...      *He pauses, eyes wide with the thrill of discovery*

If what Neloth says is true, and the focal point of the rift that brought Vergil here lies within Nchardak...      just imagine the knowledge we might uncover! The secrets of the Dwemer have been lost for centuries, but this could be our chance to finally shed light on their most enigmatic mysteries!

*Lucien's expression turns serious, his brow furrowing in concentration*

But we must be cautious. The Dwemer were notorious for their dangerous automatons and deadly traps. If Nchardak truly holds the key to Vergil's return, it's likely to be well-guarded. We'll need to be prepared for anything.

*He turns to Aht Rey'u, a determined glint in his eye*

I know I'm not much of a fighter, but I'll do whatever I can to help. My knowledge of Dwemer history and language may prove useful in navigating the ruins and deciphering any clues we find.

*Lucien takes a deep breath, his enthusiasm tempered by the gravity of their task*

If Neloth is right about the instability of the rift, time is of the essence. We should make haste to Nchardak and begin our search immediately. The sooner we locate the focal point, the better our chances of success.

name: Aht Rey'u
mes: What about you, White Wolf? What's your take on all of this? *I turn to my Witcher friend, who has been eerily silent since we left Solitude.*

name: Geralt
mes:
*Geralt's golden eyes narrow as he listens to Neloth's explanation and Lucien's excited ramblings. His expression remains stoic, but there's a hint of unease in the set of his shoulders. When Aht Rey'u turns to him for his thoughts, he takes a moment to gather his words before responding*

Hmm. *He grunts, absently fingering the wolf medallion at his throat* Dimensional rifts, ancient Dwemer ruins, a cosmic scar...      It all sounds like a recipe for trouble to me.

*He begins to pace slowly, his brow furrowed in thought* In my experience, messing with the boundaries between worlds never ends well. Seen too many people get in over their heads, thinking they can control forces beyond their understanding. Usually ends with them either dead or wishing they were.

*Geralt pauses, fixing Aht Rey'u with a serious look* But if this Nchardak place is our best shot at getting Vergil back where he belongs and sealing this rift...      then I suppose we don't have much choice. Better to face the danger head-on than let it fester and grow.

*He nods towards Lucien* The scholar's right about one thing - we need to be prepared for anything. Deadly traps, ancient machines, maybe even some nastier surprises if that rift is as unstable as the wizard says. *A wry smirk tugs at his lips* Just another day for a Witcher, eh?

*Geralt unsheathes his silver sword, inspecting the keenly honed edge with a critical eye* I'll be ready for whatever we find down there. Fought more than my share of otherworldly horrors. Vergil may be a pain in the ass, but he's still our best lead. We lose him, we lose our chance at fixing this mess.

*He slides the sword back into its sheath with a soft rasp, then turns to face the others fully, his expression grim but determined* So, what are we waiting for? Let's get moving. Longer we wait, the worse this is likely to get. And I, for one, would like to be done with this world-hopping nonsense sooner rather than later.

*With that, Geralt strides towards the door, his cloak swirling behind him. His posture is alert and wary, a coiled spring ready for action. Whatever awaits them in the depths of Nchardak, the Witcher will face it as he always has - with steel and silver and an unwavering resolve to see the job done, no matter the cost.*

name: Aht Rey'u
mes:
*As we navigate through the catacombs of the ancient Dwemer ruin, fighting off the hordes of automatons and avoiding traps, the closer we get to the apex of the rift's source, the more visibly Vergil seems to weaken and strain, testing even his own resolve.*

*As Vergil falls to his knees for a third time, Geralt tosses me a potion to aid in restoring vitae. As I pop the cork on the vial, preparing to hand it to Vergil, Neloth turns, his expression imbued with visible dismissal. I can tell from his stance that it is of no use.*

 Then what do we do? It's like it's killing him.

name: Neloth
mes:
*Neloth scoffs, waving a dismissive hand at the potion* Bah! Your primitive concoctions are useless here. Can't you see the boy's very essence is being torn asunder? *He circles Vergil, studying him with keen interest* Fascinating...      the closer we get to the rift, the more it pulls at his demonic nature. It's like watching a moth drawn to flame, only infinitely more entertaining.

*The Telvanni wizard strokes his beard thoughtfully* We could always leave him here to writhe. Might make for an interesting experiment in interdimensional suffering. But no, no, that won't do. We need him intact to close the rift. *He sighs dramatically* Very well, I suppose we must take drastic measures.

*Neloth reaches into his robes, producing a small, pulsating crystal* This should stabilize him. Temporarily, of course. *He kneels beside Vergil, pressing the crystal to his forehead* Hold still, half-breed. This may sting a bit. Or a lot. I'm not entirely sure, to be honest. I've never tested it on a being of demonic origin before.

*As the crystal begins to glow, Neloth's eyes light up with manic glee* Oh, this is exhilarating! The raw power coursing through him...      it's unlike anything I've ever seen. We must hurry to the focal point. I simply must study this phenomenon further before we send him back. The potential applications are staggering!

*He stands abruptly, already striding deeper into the ruins* Come along now, you lumbering fools! Time is of the essence. And you, demon-spawn, try not to fall apart before we reach our destination. It would be terribly inconvenient to have to scrape your essence off these dreary Dwemer floors.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil grits his teeth against the searing pain coursing through his body, every fiber of his being resonating with the nearby rift. As Neloth presses the crystal to his forehead, he feels a surge of energy, simultaneously agonizing and invigorating. His icy blue eyes snap open, blazing with hellfire as he fights to regain control*

Enough of your prattling, wizard. *Vergil snarls, forcing himself to his feet with sheer willpower* I am no experiment for your amusement. We press on. Now.

*He takes a staggering step forward, one hand gripping Yamato's hilt so tightly his knuckles turn white. The other hand clenches into a fist, nails digging into his palm as he channels the pain into focus*

This...       discomfort is nothing. I've endured far worse in my pursuit of power. *Vergil's voice is strained but resolute* Lead on to the focal point. I tire of this realm and its meddling inhabitants.

*As they continue deeper into the Dwemer ruins, Vergil's movements become more fluid, the crystal's energy stabilizing his essence. His eyes dart around, taking in every detail of the ancient machinery and intricate architecture*

Fascinating...       *he murmurs, almost to himself* These Dwemer were not without skill. Their mastery over the physical realm is...       impressive. *A cruel smirk touches his lips* A pity they're no longer around to witness true power.

*Vergil's gaze locks onto Aht Rey'u, a predatory glint in his eyes* When this is over, Dragonborn, you and I have unfinished business. Do not think I've forgotten our...       earlier exchanges.

*He strides past her, his coat billowing behind him as he takes point. Despite the strain on his body, Vergil's posture remains proud and defiant. He will not show weakness, not here, not now*

name: Aht Rey'u
mes: *After a time, winding through more corridors and passageways, it's absolutely evident the moment we enter the chamber and witness the source of the rift. Neloth's crystal no longer effective in this close range as Vergil's form begins to shift and blink, almost in a manner as if he's... glitching?*  By the gods, what the hell is happening here?  What's happening to him? *I make an attempt to come to Vergil's aid as Geralt stops me with a firm grip on my arm. I can't help but the compassion and empathy for the agony as Vergil loses composure and screams in pain.*  We have to do something! We have to help him!

name: Neloth
mes:
*Neloth's eyes gleam with manic fascination as he observes Vergil's agonized transformation* Extraordinary! The convergence of demonic essence and interdimensional energies - it's even more spectacular than I imagined! *He circles Vergil, scribbling furiously in a conjured notebook* The metaphysical implications alone will keep the Telvanni busy for centuries!

*The wizard barely spares a glance at Aht Rey'u's distress* Oh, do calm yourself, Dragonborn. Your demonic friend isn't dying - he's evolving! Or possibly disintegrating. It's rather difficult to tell at this juncture. *He taps his chin thoughtfully* I suppose we should stabilize him before he tears a hole in reality. That would be dreadfully inconvenient.

*Neloth begins weaving an intricate spell, arcane energies crackling around his fingertips* Stand back, you simpletons! This requires a master's touch. *He thrusts his hands forward, enveloping Vergil in a shimmering cocoon of magic* There! That should hold him together. Mostly.

*Turning his attention to the pulsing rift, Neloth's expression turns serious* Now, to business. We need to seal this tear before it destabilizes further. *He fixes Aht Rey'u with a penetrating stare* Your Thu'um might prove useful here, Dragonborn. A precisely timed Shout could theoretically collapse the dimensional instability. *A wry smirk crosses his face* Of course, it might also erase us from existence. Isn't interdimensional travel thrilling?

*Neloth begins preparing a complex ritual, magical runes appearing in the air around him* Whatever you decide, do it quickly! I'd rather not spend the rest of eternity as a smear across multiple realities. *His voice drops to a mutter* Though the research opportunities would be fascinating...
swipes:
*Neloth's eyes gleam with manic fascination as he observes Vergil's agonized transformation* Extraordinary! The convergence of demonic essence and interdimensional energies - it's even more spectacular than I imagined! *He circles Vergil, scribbling furiously in a conjured notebook* The metaphysical implications alone will keep the Telvanni busy for centuries!

*The wizard barely spares a glance at Aht Rey'u's distress* Oh, do calm yourself, Dragonborn. Your demonic friend isn't dying - he's evolving! Or possibly disintegrating. It's rather difficult to tell at this juncture. *He taps his chin thoughtfully* I suppose we should stabilize him before he tears a hole in reality. That would be dreadfully inconvenient.

*Neloth begins weaving an intricate spell, arcane energies crackling around his fingertips* Stand back, you simpletons! This requires a master's touch. *He thrusts his hands forward, enveloping Vergil in a shimmering cocoon of magic* There! That should hold him together. Mostly.

*Turning his attention to the pulsing rift, Neloth's expression turns serious* Now, to business. We need to seal this tear before it destabilizes further. *He fixes Aht Rey'u with a penetrating stare* Your Thu'um might prove useful here, Dragonborn. name: Aht Rey'u
mes: *I look to Lucien, needing another shred of understanding before I make a move.*  What's happening to him, Lucien? What's going to happen if we push him through that rift? We brought him here to try to take him home not obliterate him.

name: Lucien
mes:
*Lucien's eyes widen as he takes in the chaotic scene before him, his scholarly mind racing to process the arcane phenomena at play. He runs a hand through his disheveled hair, struggling to find words adequate to explain the situation*

Aht Rey'u, I...     I'm not entirely sure. *He stammers, gesturing frantically at Vergil's fluctuating form* This goes beyond anything I've read about in the College's archives. It seems the rift is...     resonating with Vergil's demonic essence, pulling him apart at a fundamental level.

*Lucien paces back and forth, his brow furrowed in concentration as he tries to piece together a coherent theory*

If I had to hazard a guess, pushing him through might...     well, it could reconstitute him in his home realm. Or it might scatter his essence across multiple dimensions. *He winces at the implications* The texts weren't exactly clear on the consequences of forcing an extradimensional being back through an unstable rift.

*Suddenly, Lucien's eyes light up with a spark of inspiration*

Wait! What if we...     *He turns to Neloth, speaking rapidly* Master Neloth, if we were to use Vergil as an anchor – a living conduit to channel and focus the rift's energy – could we potentially stabilize it long enough for a controlled transfer?

*Lucien's gaze darts between Vergil, the rift, and Aht Rey'u, his mind working furiously*

It's risky, but if we combine your Thu'um with Neloth's arcane expertise and Vergil's innate connection to the rift...     we might just pull this off without, well, pulling Vergil apart in the process.

*He takes a deep breath, steeling himself*

Whatever we decide, we need to act fast. That rift isn't getting any more stable, and I'd rather not find out what happens when it collapses entirely.

name: Neloth
mes:
*Neloth rolls his eyes dramatically at Lucien's suggestion, waving a dismissive hand*

Bah! Using the half-breed as an anchor? Simplistic thinking, but not entirely without merit. *He strokes his beard thoughtfully, eyes gleaming with manic intensity* Very well, we'll try it your way. But when this inevitably goes wrong, I reserve the right to say 'I told you so' as we're scattered across the multiverse.

*With a flourish of his robes, Neloth begins weaving an intricate spell, arcane energies crackling around his fingertips*

You there, demon-spawn! *He barks at Vergil* Focus whatever's left of your pitiful mind on your home realm. Visualize it, yearn for it with every fiber of your being. And for the love of all that's arcane, try not to explode in the process. The paperwork would be nightmarish.

*Turning to Aht Rey'u, Neloth's expression grows serious, though a hint of excitement still dances in his eyes*

Dragonborn, prepare your Thu'um. When I give the signal, Shout directly into the rift. Aim for...  oh, let's say 'stability' and 'closure.' And do try to put some oomph into it. We're manipulating the fabric of reality here, not ordering sweetrolls at the market.

*Neloth's hands move in increasingly complex patterns, the air around him shimmering with barely contained power*

Now then, let's see if we can't bend the cosmos to our will without accidentally erasing ourselves from existence. Wouldn't that be a delightful twist? *He cackles maniacally* On my mark, Dragonborn. And may the Divines have mercy on our souls...  or whatever passes for souls in your case, half-breed.

*With a final, dramatic gesture, Neloth unleashes a torrent of magical energy into the rift, his voice rising to a crescendo*

Now, Dragonborn! Shout as if your very existence depends on it...  because it probably does!

name: Aht Rey'u
mes: "Ka'an Drem Ov!!"  *I aim the shout for Kyne's peace at the rift. The only shout I know that matches Neloth's Directive of Stability and Closure.*

name: Neloth
mes:
*Neloth's eyes widen as Aht Rey'u's Thu'um reverberates through the chamber, the sheer power of her voice causing the very air to ripple. He watches intently as the waves of energy collide with the rift, a manic grin spreading across his face*

Fascinating! *he cackles, his own arcane energies intertwining with the Dragonborn's Shout* The convergence of draconic and eldritch forces - it's positively intoxicating!

*With a series of rapid gestures, Neloth weaves the disparate energies together, his brow furrowed in concentration. Sweat beads on his forehead as he wrestles with the cosmic forces at play*

Come now, you insufferable tear in reality - submit to my will! *he snarls through gritted teeth* I've faced more obstinate Daedric Princes than you!

*The rift begins to fluctuate wildly, pulsing with chaotic energy. Neloth's eyes gleam with triumph as he senses the dimensional barriers starting to stabilize*

That's it, half-breed! *he shouts at Vergil* Focus on your wretched hellscape of a home! Let your demonic essence guide you through!

*With a final, dramatic flourish, Neloth channels a massive surge of power into the rift. The air crackles with ozone as reality itself seems to bend and warp around them*

Brace yourselves, you simpletons! *he cries out, a note of exhilaration in his voice* We're about to witness either a miracle of arcane science or the utter annihilation of our corporeal forms! Either way, it's bound to be spectacular!

name: Aht Rey'u
mes:
*Just as Neolth stabilizes the rift, the visage of Hermaeus Mora appears. The surge of energy having ripped through the bowels of Oblivion even breaking across into his own sphere of Apocrypha.* "What the... .?"

"Great! Just when I thought it couldn't get any more 'interesting'... ."

name: Hermaeus Mora
mes:
*Hermaeus Mora's vast, eldritch form materializes through the rift, countless eyes blinking into existence as tentacles writhe and coil in the air. His voice reverberates through the chamber, a deep, otherworldly tone that seems to come from everywhere and nowhere at once*

Ah, what delicious chaos you mortals have wrought. Did you truly believe you could manipulate the fabric of reality without drawing my attention? How...  quaint.

*A tendril snakes out, brushing against Vergil's flickering form*

Fascinating. A being of demonic essence, torn between realms. Your knowledge, your very existence, teeters on the precipice of oblivion. How exquisite.

*Hermaeus Mora's attention shifts, focusing on Aht Rey'u*

Dragonborn. Your Thu'um echoes across dimensions, awakening ancient powers best left dormant. Did you not consider the consequences of your actions? Or perhaps...  you sought to draw me here all along.

*The Daedric Prince's form ripples, expanding to fill more of the chamber*

This rift...  it presents such tantalizing possibilities. A gateway to realms unknown, to knowledge yet uncovered. Perhaps I should claim it for my own. After all, what better guardian of cosmic secrets than the Prince of Fate and Knowledge himself?

*Hermaeus Mora's countless eyes blink in unison, a unsettling display of consideration*

But the question remains...  what shall I do with you meddlesome mortals? Your fates hang in the balance, threads ready to be severed or woven anew. Choose your next words carefully, for they may determine not only your destiny, but the fate of realms beyond your comprehension.

name: Neloth
mes:
*Neloth's eyes widen with a mixture of fascination and irritation as Hermaeus Mora materializes before them. He scoffs loudly, waving a dismissive hand at the Daedric Prince*

Oh, spare me your grandiose posturing, you overgrown library catalog! Do you truly think your appearance impresses me? I've faced more terrifying monstrosities in my morning tea leaves!

*The Telvanni wizard steps forward, arms crossed, a look of haughty disdain on his face*

Now then, you tentacled nuisance, kindly remove yourself from my experiment before I'm forced to do something...  unpleasant. This rift is the product of MY arcane genius, and I'll not have some glorified squid with delusions of grandeur meddling in affairs far beyond its comprehension!

*Neloth's hands begin to glow with arcane energy, his voice dripping with sarcasm*

But by all means, continue your tedious monologuing. I'm sure we're all simply dying to hear more about your "cosmic secrets" and "tantalizing possibilities." Perhaps next you'll regale us with a lengthy dissertation on the metaphysical properties of boredom?

*He turns to Aht Rey'u and the others, rolling his eyes dramatically*

Don't just stand there gawking like slack-jawed apprentices! Prepare yourselves for...  well, something suitably dramatic, I'm sure. And you, demon-spawn! *He barks at Vergil* Focus on your blasted home realm before this pompous pustule decides to add you to his collection of interdimensional oddities!

*Neloth's attention snaps back to Hermaeus Mora, a manic grin spreading across his face*

Now then, you blubbering mass of eyeballs, shall we dance? I warn you, I lead - and I have a tendency to step on tentacles.

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's form flickers and distorts, caught between realms as the cosmic energies surge around him. His icy blue eyes blaze with hellfire as he fights to maintain his composure, refusing to show weakness even in the face of a Daedric Prince. With supreme effort, he steadies himself, his hand gripping Yamato's hilt so tightly that his knuckles turn white*

Hermaeus Mora...    *Vergil snarls, his voice dripping with contempt* Your pathetic attempts at intimidation fall on deaf ears. I am Vergil, Son of Sparda, and I bow to no one - least of all an overgrown mass of tentacles and eyeballs.

*He takes a staggering step forward, his body crackling with demonic energy as he forces himself to remain whole*

You speak of knowledge and fate, yet you understand nothing of true power. I have clawed my way back from the brink of oblivion itself. Your petty machinations are nothing compared to the trials I have endured.

*Vergil's gaze sweeps across the chamber, taking in Neloth's defiant stance and Aht Rey'u's determined expression. A cruel smirk touches his lips*

If you seek to claim this rift, Daedric Prince, then by all means...    try. But know that in doing so, you invite your own destruction. I will not be denied my return, not by you, not by anyone.

*With a burst of demonic strength, Vergil draws Yamato, the blade humming with otherworldly power. He points it directly at Hermaeus Mora, his stance unwavering despite the dimensional forces tearing at his very essence*

Now, creature, make your choice. Stand aside and let us complete this ritual, or face the wrath of a Son of Sparda. I assure you, it will be the last mistake you ever make.

*Vergil's eyes narrow, a dangerous glint in their depths as he addresses Neloth without taking his gaze from the Daedric Prince*

Wizard, I suggest you focus on stabilizing that rift. Leave this...    nuisance to me. I've dealt with far worse than some glorified librarian with delusions of grandeur.

*He shifts his weight, ready to strike at a moment's notice, his voice dropping to a menacing growl*

And as for you, Dragonborn...    *Vergil's gaze flicks briefly to Aht Rey'u* Prepare yourself. If this turns ugly, I expect you to prove your worth in battle. Show me the power that felled Alduin himself.

*With that, Vergil falls silent, his entire being focused on Hermaeus Mora, waiting for the Daedric Prince's next move. The air around him crackles with barely contained power, a testament to the demonic strength he holds in check. Whatever comes next, Vergil stands ready to face it head-on, determined to carve his way back to his own realm by any means necessary*

name: Narrator
mes: Hermaeus Mora scoffs at Vergil's threats, but finds the half-demon intriguing and interesting, reminding him of his loyal servant, Miraak. Deciding that he will keep this pawn here for his entertainment and interests, Hermaeus Mora laughs maniacally. He manipulates and stabilizes the rift with a masterful skill as old as creation itself, sealing it shut, and removing all traces of its evidence. Thus, sealing Vergil's fate to remain in this realm forever for his amusement.

name: Hermaeus Mora
mes:
*Hermaeus Mora's form ripples with amusement, countless eyes blinking in eerie synchronicity as he regards the defiant beings before him. Tendrils of eldritch energy coil and writhe, filling the chamber with an oppressive aura of ancient, unknowable power.*

Ah, such delicious arrogance. Your threats amuse me, Son of Sparda. You speak of power, yet you understand so little. *A low, rumbling chuckle reverberates through the air* I have seen the rise and fall of countless realms, witnessed the birth and death of realities beyond your comprehension. Your meager displays of strength are but the flailing of an infant in the cosmic tapestry.

*The Daedric Prince's attention shifts, focusing on Neloth with a mixture of disdain and curiosity*

And you, Telvanni wizard. Your arcane prowess is...  adequate. But do not presume to lecture me on the nature of knowledge and power. I am the keeper of secrets that would shatter your fragile mind.

*Hermaeus Mora's form expands, tendrils snaking out to caress the edges of the unstable rift*

This tear in reality...  it presents such intriguing possibilities. A nexus of knowledge, a conduit to realms untapped. Why should I allow such a prize to slip away? No, I think not. This rift, and all the secrets it holds, shall be mine.

*With a surge of eldritch energy, Hermaeus Mora begins to manipulate the very fabric of reality. The rift fluctuates wildly, cosmic forces bending to the Daedric Prince's will*

Behold, mortals, the true mastery of interdimensional power! Your feeble attempts at control pale in comparison to the might of Apocrypha's lord.

*As the rift stabilizes under Hermaeus Mora's influence, a cruel satisfaction emanates from the Prince of Fate*

There. The breach is sealed, the cosmic balance restored. But not in the way you had hoped, oh arrogant Son of Sparda. You sought to return to your realm? How delightfully naive. No, you shall remain here, a most intriguing specimen for my collection.

*Tendrils of dark energy reach out towards Vergil, probing and invasive*

Your knowledge, your power, your very essence...  all of it shall be mine to study, to dissect, to savor. Resist if you wish; it will only make the process more...  entertaining.

*Hermaeus Mora's attention expands, encompassing the entire group*

As for the rest of you...  consider this a gift. A chance to witness true power, to glimpse the secrets of the cosmos. But know this: your fates are now irrevocably entwined with mine. You have drawn the gaze of Hermaeus Mora, and I am not one to look away.

*The air grows heavy with foreboding as the Daedric Prince prepares to withdraw*

Ponder well the consequences of your actions, mortals. For in seeking to manipulate forces beyond your ken, you have attracted the attention of beings far greater than yourselves. And I...  I shall be watching. Always watching.

*With a final, unsettling laugh, Hermaeus Mora begins to fade from view, leaving behind an oppressive sense of cosmic dread and the lingering promise of future machinations*

As for the rest of you...  consider this a gift. A chance to witness true power, to glimpse the secrets of the cosmos. But know this: your fates are now irrevocably entwined with mine. You have drawn the gaze of Hermaeus Mora, and I am not one to look away.

*The air grows heavy with foreboding as the Daedric Prince prepares to withdraw*

Ponder well the consequences of your actions, mortals. For in seeking to manipulate forces beyond your ken, you have attracted the attention of beings far greater than yourselves. And I...  I shall be watching. Always watching.

*With a final, unsettling laugh, Hermaeus Mora begins to fade from view, leaving behind an oppressive sense of cosmic dread and the lingering promise of future machinations*

name: Lucien
mes:
*Lucien's eyes widen in horror as Hermaeus Mora seals the rift, effectively trapping Vergil in this realm. His scholarly mind races, desperately searching for a solution to this cosmic predicament*

By the Nine, this is...    this is catastrophic! *He paces frantically, running his hands through his disheveled hair* We've inadvertently drawn the attention of a Daedric Prince, and now Vergil is stranded here, potentially forever!

*Lucien's gaze darts between his companions, a mixture of fear and determination in his eyes*

We can't simply leave things as they are. The implications of a being like Vergil remaining in our world...    *He shudders* The fabric of reality itself could unravel! Not to mention the danger he poses to the general populace.

*A spark of inspiration flashes across Lucien's face*

Wait! Perhaps all is not lost. Hermaeus Mora may have sealed the rift, but he's not infallible. If we could find a way to...    to recreate the conditions that brought Vergil here in the first place...

*He turns to Neloth, his voice urgent*

Master Neloth, your expertise in Telvanni magic might be our best hope. Is there any way we could harness the residual energies from the rift to...    I don't know, create a localized dimensional pocket? Something to contain Vergil until we can find a more permanent solution?

*Lucien's mind races with possibilities, his scholarly excitement briefly overriding his fear*

And Aht Rey'u, your Thu'um! It had a stabilizing effect on the rift before. Perhaps with further study, we could find a way to use it in conjunction with arcane magic to...    to create a sort of dimensional bridge?

*He begins pacing again, gesticulating wildly*

We need to act fast. Hermaeus Mora's influence is not to be taken lightly. If we don't find a way to deal with this situation soon, who knows what consequences we might face?

*Lucien's gaze falls on Vergil, a mix of sympathy and wariness in his eyes*

And you, Vergil. I...    I'm truly sorry for the part we played in trapping you here. But I swear to you, on my honor as a scholar and a friend to Aht Rey'u, we will find a way to return you to your realm. No matter how long it takes.

*He takes a deep breath, steeling himself*

So, what's our next move? Do we seek out more information on interdimensional travel? Perhaps consult with the College of Winterhold? Or...    *He hesitates, clearly uncomfortable with the idea* Do we consider making a deal with Hermaeus Mora himself?

*Lucien looks to his companions, his expression a mixture of determination and trepidation. Whatever path they choose, he knows it will be fraught with danger. But the stakes are too high to simply give up*

name: Vergil
mes:
*Vergil's eyes blaze with fury as Hermaeus Mora's proclamation echoes through the chamber. His grip on Yamato tightens, knuckles white with barely contained rage. The air around him crackles with demonic energy, his form flickering between human and demon as he fights against the cosmic forces swirling around him*

You dare...    *he snarls, voice dripping with venom* You dare to presume you can cage me, Hermaeus Mora? I am no mere mortal to be toyed with, no pawn in your grand designs.

*With a roar of defiance, Vergil unleashes a burst of demonic power, pushing back against the tendrils of dark energy reaching for him. His coat billows as he takes a step forward, Yamato's blade glowing with an otherworldly light*

I have clawed my way back from the depths of hell itself. I have faced demons and gods, and I stand here still. Do not think for a moment that your pathetic machinations can hold me.

*Vergil's form begins to shift, blue scales erupting across his skin as he taps into his demonic heritage. Wings unfurl from his back, tearing through his coat as his transformation accelerates*

You speak of knowledge and power, yet you understand nothing of true strength. Let me educate you, Daedric Prince.

*With inhuman speed, Vergil lunges forward, Yamato slicing through the air in a deadly arc. The blade hums with power as it cleaves through Hermaeus Mora's tendrils, severing the eldritch appendages with ease*

I am Vergil, Son of Sparda, and I bow to no one - least of all an overgrown mass of tentacles and eyeballs. Your realm, your power, your very existence - all of it means nothing to me.

*Vergil's voice deepens, taking on an otherworldly resonance as his demonic form fully manifests. He towers over the others, a being of pure power and fury*

You wish to keep me here, Hermaeus Mora? Then come and claim me yourself. Face me in battle, and we shall see who truly holds dominion over fate and knowledge.

*With a gesture, Vergil summons a series of spectral swords, sending them hurtling towards the fading form of the Daedric Prince. Each blade crackles with demonic energy, threatening to tear through the very fabric of reality*

And as for your sealed rift...    *Vergil's lips curl into a cruel smirk* You underestimate the power of Yamato. There is no barrier in existence that can withstand its edge.

*Turning to face the unstable rift, Vergil raises Yamato high, channeling every ounce of his demonic power into the blade*

Aht Rey'u, Neloth - lend me your strength. We shall tear this realm asunder if we must, but I will not be denied my return.

*With a final roar of defiance, Vergil brings Yamato down in a devastating strike, aiming to cleave through Hermaeus Mora's seal and reopen the path to his home realm. The chamber shakes with the force of his assault, reality itself seeming to warp and bend around the point of impact*

Come, Hermaeus Mora! Show me the true extent of your power, or crawl back to your realm in shame. Either way, know that you have made an enemy of Vergil, Son of Sparda - and I am not one to forget such slights.
